This is important, so we will say it again! A **variable** is used to **store information.**
All variables have a **name** and all variables can **store** information.
A variable then, is like a container with a name.
Variables can store many types of information such as numbers, words (a string) or more complicated informaion such as lists.
Put up your hand and wait for an instructor to come over, describe to them what a variable is, what it is used for and what type of information you can store in it
